lead_paragraph: California air regulators are moving to relax a controversial and closely watched program that would force automobile manufacturers to sell electric cars starting in 2003. Conceding that battery-powered cars are not yet practical, the staff of the California Air Resources Board today recommended de-emphasizing fully electric vehicles and instead giving more encouragement to other types of ''clean'' cars, such as hybrid vehicles that combine gasoline and electric power.
abstract: California Air Resources Board moves to relax program that would force automobile manufacturers to sell electric cars in 2003; recommends de-emphasizing fully electric vehicles and instead giving more encouragement to other types of 'clean' cars, such as hybrid vehicles that combine gasoline and electric power (M)

headline.main: New Plan Would Scale Back Quota for Electric Cars in California
